intro: Malcolmia trichocarpa, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its showy, five-petaled yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. Malcolmia trichocarpa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
